name: Sumerian/Babylonian Mythology
description:
The Epic of Gilgamesh
is the oldest known work of epic literature, originating in ancient Mesopotamia around 2100 BCE.
It tells the story of Gilgamesh, the mighty king of Uruk,
and his quest for immortality following the death of his beloved companion
Enkidu.
The epic explores timeless themes of friendship, mortality, legacy, and the limits of human ambition,
establishing narrative patterns that would echo through world literature for millennia.
relatedConcepts: Gilgamesh - The hero king of Uruk
Ishtar/Inanna - Goddess of love and war
Enlil - Lord of wind and storm
The Odyssey - Later Greek epic parallel
participants: Gilgamesh - The hero king of Uruk
Ishtar/Inanna - Goddess of love and war
Enlil - Lord of wind and storm
